text: ℞ or Rx was a one-off side project by Skinny Puppy band member Nivek Ogre, in collaboration with Invisible Records founder Martin Atkins."Rx – Bedside Toxicology – Ogre – Interview". Lollipop Magazine, Chris Best, November, 1998 The project was originally called Ritalin, but the name was changed for legal reasons. Rx released an album of industrial rock music, Bedside Toxicology, in 1998."Rx Bedside Toxicology". AllMusic, Review by John Bush == Discography == *Bedside Toxicology (1998)"POET or CLOWN?". Release Magazine - Spotlight, By: Kristoffer Noheden "Bedside Toxicology". DropD Magazine, December 5, 1998. Dorothy Parvaz *Dubs (2006, Limited to 500 copies) == See also == *Pigface, a band featuring Martin Atkins ==References== Category:Skinny Puppy Category:Musical groups established in 1998 Category:Musical groups disestablished in 2006 Category:Musical groups from Vancouver Category:Canadian industrial music groups Category:1998 establishments in British Columbia Category:2006 disestablishments in British Columbia
title: Rx (band)
